methods_proposed.name: Linear Regression with Lags
methods_proposed.description: Linear regression using lag_1, lag_2, lag_3 features
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_linear_lags(train_df, test_df, target_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
    # Prepare features
    X_train = train_df[['lag_1', 'lag_2', 'lag_3']].fillna(0)
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    X_test = test_df[['lag_1', 'lag_2', 'lag_3']].fillna(0)
    # Train model
    model = LinearRegression()
    model.fit(X_train, y_train)
    # Predict
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)

methods_proposed.name: Random Forest with Lags
methods_proposed.description: Random Forest regressor using lag features
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_rf_lags(train_df, test_df, target_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
    # Prepare features
    X_train = train_df[['lag_1', 'lag_2', 'lag_3']].fillna(0)
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    X_test = test_df[['lag_1', 'lag_2', 'lag_3']].fillna(0)
    # Train model
    model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, max_depth=3, random_state=42)
    model.fit(X_train, y_train)
    # Predict
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)
